alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Randolph; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 5:48AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following counties, Barbour, Randolph and Upshur. * WHEN...Until 830 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 546 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated rain has diminished across the warned area but runoff from earlier rains is likely resulting in some flooding of secondary roads. - Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Buckhannon, Philippi, Audra State Park, Tallmansville, Ellamore, Overhill, Alton, Alexander, Helvetia, Volga and Eden.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
